authorities.name: FGC (Ferrocarrils de la Generalitat de Catalunya)

modes.notes: 12 lines covering city and suburbs. Lines L1-L5, L9, L10, L11. Trains run every 2-4 minutes during peak times.
Over 1,000 buses on 230+ day routes plus 30 night routes. Day buses run 5:30am-10:30pm; night buses (N prefix) run 10:30pm-5:30am.
6 lines across 2 networks serving outer city areas. Complements metro network with transfer points.
Commuter rail and metro lines serving suburban areas. Llobregat–Anoia and Vallès lines connect Sant Cugat and Terrassa.
12 Rodalies lines (R1-R11, R8) serving broader metropolitan area. Connects Barcelona to Sitges, Mataró, Vic and surrounding regions.
Cable cars and funiculars available, including routes to Montjuïc.

payment_methods.details: Single journey ticket valid on metro, bus, tram, FGC and Renfe (Zone 1). €2.40 per journey.
10 journeys on integrated transport (metro, bus, tram, FGC, Renfe Zone 1). Shareable between passengers.
Unlimited travel for 2-5 consecutive days on metro, buses, trams, FGC, Renfe, and airport transfers.
Credit/debit cards accepted at metro and bus validators. Tap-to-pay available on most transport modes.

operating_hours.weekday: Metro: 5am-midnight Monday-Thursday. Buses: 5:30am-10:30pm day service. FGC and Renfe: 5am-11pm approximately.
operating_hours.weekend: Metro: Friday-Saturday extended to 1am; Sunday until midnight. Buses: 5:30am-10:30pm day service. Night buses available.
operating_hours.night_service: Night buses (N lines) operate 10:30pm-5:30am. Metro runs 24/7 on Saturdays. Aerobús operates 24/7, 365 days/year.

rideshare.notes: Fantastic bike-sharing network available throughout city.
E-scooter rental available for short trips.

tips: Use integrated T-10 ticket or Hola Barcelona card for seamless transfers across metro, bus, tram, FGC and Renfe within Zone 1. Metro is fastest and cheapest option; stations at major attractions. Download TMB app for real-time schedules and route planning. Night buses (N prefix) available if traveling after 10:30pm. Validate ticket at entry; transfers allowed within time/zone limits. Business travelers should consider 2-5 day Hola Barcelona card for unlimited airport and city travel. Metro runs 24/7 on Saturdays; plan accordingly for weekend travel.
